publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2590 Tommy Sheridan: Motion by Jack McConnell on Student Loans-That the Parliament affirms that "education is a right and not a privilege to be paid for, that a student loans system would seriously affect the numbers of students who come from working class and ethnic minority backgrounds and would decrease the number of mature and women students entering higher education, and that instead of considering a loans system, the Government should be removing the means test and providing a full grant for all"; and notes that the above is the text of a motion moved by Jack McConnell at a General Meeting of the Students' Association on 29 September 1980 when a student at Stirling University and congratulates him on his sentiments then.

S1M-2590 Tommy Sheridan: Motion by Jack McConnell on Student Loans—That the Parliament affirms that "education is a right and not a privilege to be paid for, that a student loans system would seriously affect the numbers of students who come from working class and ethnic minority backgrounds and would decrease the number of mature and women students entering higher education, and that instead of considering a loans system, the Government should be removing the means test and providing a full grant for all"; and notes that the above is the text of a motion moved by Jack McConnell at a General Meeting of the Students’ Association on 29 September 1980 when a student at Stirling University and congratulates him on his sentiments then.
